page.title: 01 THE HIGHCLIFFE AREA
page.content: Our block for the Domesday Project overlooks{Christchurch Bay.}It includes the following local places: {Hinton, Eastern Highcliffe, Walkford, {Barton_on_Sea, Western New Milton}and} {Old Milton.}The land is fairly flat } and about 30 metres above sea level. Many retired people live here and they mainly live in bungalows. Most of the bungalows have been built since the 2nd World War. Many holiday-makers come to the two caravan sites and some go to the beach. In the north there is some agricultural land. We are near the{New Forest.}A railway station is in the north of our block. Until 1974 all of our block was part of Hampshire, but now part of it is in Dorset. There is just one small industrial estate in{New Milton}which} has grown in the last few years. By Victoria Coubro and Kerry Pearce.
